text: The polka-dog tree frog, fasciated frog or spotted tree frog (Boana punctata) is a frog that lives in Brazil, Ecuador, Paraguay, Bolivia, Colombia, Trinidad, the Guyanas, and Argentina. Scientists have seen them as high as 1400 meters above sea level. These frogs have green skin on their backs with small red spots. The adult male frog is 31 to 40 mm long from nose to rear end and the adult female frog is 34.0 to 41.7 mm long. They can live in forests, canals, and farms. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Polka-dot tree frog
